actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law

official_title: To clarify the application of the antitrust laws to certain agreements imposing territorial limitations on the distribution of trademarked products for resale.

summary.text: Interbrand Competition Act of 1989 - Declares that it shall not be unlawful under Federal antitrust laws for a manufacturer, importer, trademark owner, or trademark licensee of a trademarked product to grant a wholesale distributor the exclusive right to distribute and sell such product in a defined geographical area and to limit the distribution and sale of such product only for ultimate resale to consumers within such area when such product is in substantial and effective competition with other products within the relevant markets.

titles.title: To clarify the application of the antitrust laws to certain agreements imposing territorial limitations on the distribution of trademarked products for resale.
